page.title: 10Augustus John.
page.content: {Augustus John}was born in 1878 and studied art at The Slade School, London. As he became more famous he became richer and was able to buy Fryern Court in 1928. {Fryern Court}was originally a monastery called Frerern Court. The name was then changed to Fryern Court. The main part of the house was designed in 1805. In 1932 the Johns asked Christopher Nicholson to design the front part of the house (front door and windows) and a room going off to the side. It is a Grade two listed building which means everything the owners want renewed has to be made exactly like the original. Augustus' new studio has now been turned into flats. In the Recreation Ground, on the bank of the River Avon,{a statue}of this famous artist can be seen.
